title.narrative: Provision of lifesaving Trauma and Nutrition care services in response to the conflict in Marib.

description.narrative:
The project aims to enable WHO to enhance and sustain critical highly specialized 24/7 lifesaving medical care and nutrition service in 6 TFCs covering 14 districts affected by conflict and with high levels of food insecurity and acute malnutrition, to decrease excess mortality rate; children under five and caregivers are targeted under this component. The project also responds to the current humanitarian emergency health needs of those directly affected people in conflict-affected areas in Marib in Trauma Care Management. WHO deploys four Surgical teams in Marib General Hospitals, Kara Hospital, 26 Sept. Hospital and Hareeb Hospital (one team in each hospital) and also supports referrals by covering operational cost for twelve ambulance vehicles in four conflict affected districts in Marib, in addition to provide regular fuel supply to the above mentioned hospitals to ensure continuous hospitals functioning.
The project targets a total of 4,000 affected people with its Health component and 1,454 affected people with its Nutrition component.
